body: You would have to use HAWQ-1492. <TITLE> format for this pull request to show up with the jira
Pushed to master, please feel free to close a PR.

@linwen @denalex @stanlyxiang @zhangh43  help to review, thanks.

I was going to use `setProperty("java.security.auth.login.config", conf_file)`, but it not works.

After refer some ranger code, it seems ranger do some hacks by `org.apache.ranger.audit.utils.InMemoryJAASConfiguration`, so I use the same class as Ranger does.

Tested on my test vagrant cluster, passed.
@radarwave committed the final changes, doc changes pending. Will submit a PR in docs repo.

Need to fix:
run 'hawq reload' without any other arguments:

hawq reload
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/hawq/bin/hawq", line 215, in <module>
    main()
  File "/usr/local/hawq/bin/hawq", line 135, in main
    sub_args_list.append("-u")
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'sub_args_list' referenced before assignment
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/hawq/bin/hawq", line 215, in <module>
    main()
  File "/usr/local/hawq/bin/hawq", line 135, in main
    sub_args_list.append("-u")
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'sub_args_list' referenced before assignment
LGTM

You could run the test using parallel-run-feature-test.sh.

Basically the test need to set some properties so that ans files are uniform.
In parallel-run-feature-test.sh, e.g. the date style is set as below,

  run_sql "alter database $TEST_DB_NAME set datestyle to 'postgres,MDY';"

An ideal fix for this is to document it in readme, warning not to run googletest directly.
This PR has been merged into master. Please close it. Thanks!
merged

@linwen @interma  Please feel free to review this pr. Thank you.

When master is down,  it's no matter to stop segment in 'smart' or 'fast' mode. And I see this fix only affect 'hawq stop cluster', which means master is already down before stoping segments. So I think this fix is good enough to me.

+1
Agree with Radar's comment. LGTM.

Do we also need to add pxf-api.jar to the private classpath so that the Demo* use case is available to users without modifications ?

Maybe never mind, since the file seems to be shiped within the WAR file:
WEB-INF/lib/pxf-api-3.2.1.0.jar

Should it be shipped there, or should it be separate ?
@denalex i've added pxf-api jar to the pxf-private.classpath file. I haven't modified the hdp or the bigtop versions of the classpath file
Please unify the indent. We should avoid use both "space" and "tab" for indent in one source file.

Not sure which library/API version you're asking about. For the S3 API, it's likely only compatible with v4.

I'd refer to the updated _upstream_ code base for this PR here: https://github.com/greenplum-db/gpdb/tree/master/gpAux/extensions/gpcloud

The same build process I used could probably been done with this updated code.
